***** Hindi[edit] *****
**** Etymology[edit] ****
Borrowed from Classical_Persian پیچ‎ (pēč).
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * (Delhi Hindi) IPA(key): /peːt͡ʃ/
**** Noun[edit] ****
पेच • (pec) m (Urdu spelling پیچ‎)
   1. screw
   2. (figurative) an intricate matter
*** Declension[edit] ***
Declension of पेच (masc cons-stem)
                                    singular plural
                           direct   पेच      पेच
                                    pec      pec
                           oblique  पेच      पेचों
                                    pec      pecõ
                           vocative पेच      पेचो
                                    pec      peco
*** Derived terms[edit] ***
    * पेचकस (peckas)
***** Newar[edit] *****
**** Etymology[edit] ****
Ultimately from Classical_Persian پیچ‎ (pēč).
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): [pet͡ɕə]
**** Noun[edit] ****
पेच • (peca) ? (Newa Spelling 𑐥𑐾𑐔)
   1. screw
            Synonym: हिँकिं (hĩkiṃ)
